page.title: 16Morwenstow - Footpaths
page.content: There are many footpaths in the area. Some are maintained by the parish council, a few are tracks, but most are very overgrown and difficult to find. Many footpaths lead to the church, others join together farms and hamlets The scene changes very quickly as the path first crosses open fields then dips down into steep wooded valleys full of flowers. Marshy land covered in ragged robin, orchids and other bog plants contains deep muddy holes to trap the unwary, the haunts of newts and frogs. St. David's lane, a fairly direct path from Shop to Kilkhampton, may date from Roman times. One of the most difficult stretches of the South West Coastal path runs through Morwenstow. These paths yield bounteous signs of usage by former generations.
